text: There are a multiple languages of Morocco. The two official languages are Standard Arabic and Standard Moroccan Berber.2011 Constitution of Morocco Full text of the 2011 Constitution (French) Moroccan Arabic (known as Darija) is the spoken natively by many Arabs in Morocco. Some foreign language, like French, is the second language for around 33% of Moroccans."La Francophonie dans le monde ." () Organisation Internationale de la Francophonie. p. 16. Retrieved on 15 October 2012. == Education == In July 2023, the gradual generalization of learning English from secondary school was decided by the Ministry of Education.. ==References==
title: Languages of Morocco
